title: 108_s987
content: The "Rural Health Care Fairness and Medicare Equity Act of 2003" aims to equalize payment amounts between urban and rural areas under the Medicare inpatient hospital payment system. It also includes adjustments to wage indexes, establishes a floor on area wage adjustment factors, alternative guidelines for geographic reclassification of hospitals in sparsely populated states, and a floor on work geographic adjustment. The "Rural Health Care Fairness and Medicare Equity Act of 2003" aims to equalize payment amounts between urban and rural areas under the Medicare inpatient hospital payment system. The "Rural Health Care Fairness and Medicare Equity Act of 2003" aims to equalize payment amounts between urban and rural areas under the Medicare inpatient hospital payment system by amending Section 1886(d)(3)(A)(iv) of the Social Security Act. The amendment includes adjustments for standardized amounts for hospitals in different regions starting from fiscal year 2004. The amendment to Section 1886(d)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act includes changes to computing DRG-specific rates for hospitals before fiscal year 2004. The amendment to Section 1886(d)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act includes changes to computing DRG-specific rates for hospitals before fiscal year 2004, and for hospitals located in all areas after fiscal year 2003. The amendment to Section 1886(d)(3) of the Social Security Act adjusts the weighting factor for diagnosis-related groups and includes technical changes for fiscal years before 1997. SEC. 3. ADJUSTMENT TO WAGE INDEX. Section 1886(d)(3)(E) of the Social Security Act is amended to include an alternative proportion adjustment starting in fiscal year 2004, where the Secretary shall substitute '62 percent' for certain hospital payments to ensure no decrease in payments. The Social Security Act is amended to include an alternative proportion adjustment for hospital payments to prevent decreases in payments. The Secretary will apply this adjustment as if certain amendments had not been enacted. SEC. 4. FLOOR ON AREA WAGE ADJUSTMENT FACTORS USED UNDER MEDICARE PPS FOR INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT HOSPITAL SERVICES. The amendment to the Inpatient PPS under the Social Security Act includes a new clause establishing a floor on the area wage adjustment factor for Medicare payments, ensuring a minimum factor of 0.85 for discharges from October 1, 2003, onwards. The amendment to the Outpatient PPS under the Social Security Act involves adjustments for relative differences in labor and labor-related costs using factors established under clause (i) of section 1886(d)(3)(E) for items and services furnished on or after October 1, 2003. The amendment to the Outpatient PPS under the Social Security Act involves adjustments for labor costs using factors established under section 1886(d)(3)(E). Waiving budget neutrality for the application of wage adjustment factors is also addressed. Establishment of alternative guidelines for geographic reclassification of hospitals in sparsely populated states. Establishment of alternative guidelines for geographic reclassification of hospitals in sparsely populated states. The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall publish alternative guidelines for hospitals to qualify for geographic reclassification, allowing the use of other areas' standardized amounts for inpatient operating costs and wage index values. Hospitals seeking reclassification must demonstrate eligibility. The Secretary of Health and Human Services has established alternative guidelines for hospitals in sparsely populated states to qualify for geographic reclassification. Hospitals seeking reclassification must demonstrate eligibility by meeting specific criteria related to their location and proximity to the area they seek reclassification to. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a minimum work geographic index of 1.00 for payment purposes starting January 1, 2004, for localities with an index below 1.00.
